website_summaries.verdict: This lancing device's use of a multiple lancet drum spares users the aggravation of replacing single lancets after every use. We like the low price point and the sharpness of the lancets.
pros: Multiple lancets in a barrel formation, so there's no need to replace single needles
Locking mechanism prevents unsafe re-use of lancets
Six-lancet drum less expensive than other multi-click models
cons: Not spring-loaded, so there's a learning curve involved
Difficult to control the grip for a quick stick

customer_reviews.title: Easy and pain free on sensitive fingers!
customer_reviews.text: This lancing device is the most painless lancing device my husband and I have used. We test our glucose for data on our Keto diet. We have gone through several devices and they hurt my fingers so badly! I use the device on almost the most shallow lancing depth. My husband has calloused hands and has to use the deeper settings. We both experience no pain. I know it stinks to buy yet another lancing system, but this is 100% worth it if you experience pain with your lancing.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Zajk

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As The Discontinued Multiclix, But Very Close
customer_reviews.text: I like this device very much but miss my old Multiclix, which was so simple. This device works fine, is relatively painless, and (for now, at least) the Fastclix system is relatively inexpensive. If it were not for having to push the plunger to operate and the lack of automatic advancement in the needle drum, I'd give it a five. Four stars seems too little but I can't give it a five, either. I would hazard a guess and say that, the way things stand now (Multiclix being phased out), this is the best lancing device system currently on the market and readily available. If you are new to testing, this is the system to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: These are truly a God send! My old way of checking blood sugar involved several steps, but this eliminates all those pain in the ice steps. Load the cylinder into the lancing device and your good for 6 finger piercings, fast, clean, simple. I also like the fact that if you don't get blood on the first piercing, you can pierce again without rolling onto another cylinder, thus wasting a cylinder needle, just press the piercing mechanism again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The greatest way to lance with out all the pain
customer_reviews.text: the thing I like the most about this product is that you can set the depth of the lancing device from .5 up to the desired depth that is comfortable for you. Me I use the device and .5 and don't have any pain on lancing or after taking the sample because the tiny prick it makes heals very quickly. this combined with the fact we don't have to fumble with a lancet then set the device then take the lance then take the sample, uncomplicated my life in this area. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Not original packaging
customer_reviews.text: The 1st time I ordered it came in a sealed and original box with instruction. I ordered again and it was in a plastic bag with no instructions. Ordered as a 2nd Lancet for my child school and having no instructions is not professional. It should be noted not in the original box.especially when I clicked buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa gates

customer_reviews.title: Great lancet! Maybe the best design out there?
customer_reviews.text: This lancet has been by-far the best designed and most comfortable device I've discovered so far! I had found that the favored Bayer glucose meter provides me with the most-accurate blood sugar levels. What hadn't occurred to me until later is you don't need to buy (or use) the Bayer lancing device (which in my opinion is poorly designed and more painful). Instead, you can buy this one to use with *any* meter, taking advantage of the gentle pin-prick and fantastic six-needle advancing barrel design so you don't need to reload the pin each time. It goes together easily and can even be used one-handed quite simply. I would not be surprised if it's the best design out there! ;^)
customer_reviews.author: Freelancelot

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: No more having to touch the needles. The needles are contained within the barrel. I do not have to "arm" the spring before I can use the device. When I push the button, it triggers, no other step is needed. I can control when I switch needles, which means that I can reuse a needle if I need to [not recommended but sometimes money is an issue] I plan on buying replacement barrels (needles) when I need more. This device also allows me to use the palm of my hand, and my thigh to check my blood, so when my finger gets sore, I can switch how hard the needle hits to use on other parts of my body.
customer_reviews.author: Thorman

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to use, adjustable for comfort, no sharp tips to handle
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the easiest lancing device to use. A barrel fits on the tip with multiple lancets inside. On the first test, you push the end in like a plunger, then push a button. For subsequent checks, you can rotate a section at the end of the device to turn to a fresh lancet. When all are used, you pull the barrel off and dispose of it in a sharps disposal container. There is no chance to prick yourself accidentally. The lancing device is adjustable to make the piercing of your skin as painless as possible. I have tried others, but I like this device the best.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Will use nothing else from now on.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Least painless but makes good draws. Too good. I had to drop the level down a couple. Barely perceptible. They must be super sharp. So convenient. Bought here and not sure if it is coveeed under my insurance or applicable to my deductible, but well worth the peace of mind and comfort. The finger pricking is the worst part. Worse than the needles. Not having to reload lancets makes testing a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: tympanik

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I SHOULD HAVE PURCHASED THIS 20 LANCING DEVICES AGO! MY DAD HAS DIABETES AS WELL AS Alzheimer's DISEASE. HIS MEDICARE WOULD NOT COVER THIS ACCU-CHEX FASTCLIX LANCING DEVICE. I BOUGHT IT FOR HIM AFTER HAVING TO REPLACE MANY OF THE DEVICES THAT WOULD NOT HOLD UP! I WAS BUYING REPLACEMENTS FOR THE BROKEN ONES ANYWAY. IT IS VERY STURDY, EASY TO USE AND MY DAD CAN BEARLY FEEL THE STICK. I LIKE NOT HAVING TO CONTINUALLY CHANGE THE LANCET.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Bug

customer_reviews.title: The best lancing device on the market
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best lancing device. Easy to change the lancets, no exposed needles, clear usage. The only improvement I would make is to somehow make the little hole where the needle comes out more obvious. It can be hard to located in the dark. Granted I'm not lancing myself (my son has T1D), so perhaps the little bump surrounding the hole works for most people. Regardless, it's a fantastic product. We have 2 just in case we lose one. I could not go back to regular lancing devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Moncrief

customer_reviews.title: Pain Free
customer_reviews.text: almost pain free ! you never have to see the needle and it always draws blood the first time, I set it on 2 ..super easy to change the cartridge and each one holds 6 needles !! and.you won't find anything as painless as this is ! when I am in the hospital I take it with me ! the nurses are blood crazy ..lol..and this doesn't hurt..they let me use it..this is my second purchase...love it !
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: no instructions!  We did not indicate this was a drum type instrument which I thought was a single needle loader.
customer_reviews.text: Came with no instructions. Sample drum did not work. Pharmacist could not figure it out after I requested help.
customer_reviews.author: Krystyna Szelazek

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lancing device for type 1 diabetics in my opinion. I've been type 1 for nearly 40 years and picked this device up about a year ago. It is fairly easy to use and the cartridge of lancets lasts me a month or more with multiple tests per day. Good adjustment for desired penetration level. Very cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I coupled mine with a Breeze 2 meter which made the whole process of testing take less than 30 seconds. I would highly recommend anyone who has to test their blood glucose to do the same. The ease of both systems, as well as the inexpensive strips on Anazon costing a quarter a strip, made testing super easy. Disposal of ten strips and the six-cartridge drum for the accuclick is a snap. I test more frequently as a result of both systems and find it much easier than other systems I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: An excellent mid point between the typical device that is such ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very convenient lancing device. An excellent mid point between the typical device that is such a pain to change out, and the push button lancing devices that have to be thrown out after every finger stick. These let you load up for several uses, are easy to refill, and are just well designed and engineered.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY like the original
customer_reviews.text: After all these years - for some reason, the original one broke inside and I KNEW my health plan would take a week to get me another one - SO - in 24 hours I had this one here and was able to get back to monitoring my glucose levels - THANK YOU -
customer_reviews.author: BorinquenGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I was so glad to find this lancing device! Having a revolving cylinder with a lancet for each day of the week is so much more convenient than having to change out the lancet every day.
customer_reviews.author: CurlySue

customer_reviews.title: thick skin
customer_reviews.text: I must have tough skin. I'm using the highest setting and I have to mash my finger to make a big enough blood drop. Otherwise not painful and very easy to use. All that gardening has made thick finger pads.
customer_reviews.author: cwc

customer_reviews.title: Does not penetrate thick skin.
customer_reviews.text: This product probably works well if you have thin skin and fine fingers, but it did not work at all for me. I usually get my blood for testing from my wrist, and I could not get enough blood from that area either. It is probably wonderful if you don’t have thick skin, but this did not have enough pressure to penetrate deep enough to get a blood sample.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Best lancing device I've used.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best lancing device I have used. I read about it in someone else's review and decided to give it a try. I haven't tried, but doubt that Medicare will provide the lancets free as they do for my other lancing devices. The lancets come as cartridges with 6 on each. They are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Maj C. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lancing Device, Gentler on Fingers!
customer_reviews.text: If you have been struggling with blood blisters, pain, bruising from other lancing devices, the FastClix is the answer! Love the drum lancets, which makes it easier to travel. Easier on my fingers, and glad to stop causing myself so much pain.
customer_reviews.author: anonymama

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Accu-Chek fastclix lancing devices. I depend on insulin and must check my glucose many times a day, therefore it's WAY more convenient than the old way, and much less aggravation and trash. And changing the needle depth is very intuitive and quick. I change it drastically depending upon which finger i'm drawing from: Pinkie and ring fingers usually call for a depth setting of 1 or 2, but all others require 3 to 4. This Accu-Chek Fastclix is definitely a must have for people who must check their glucose many times a day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why change something that worked so good?
customer_reviews.text: The design of this was a major step backwards from the Multi-Clix! The trigger on the Multi-Clix was on the barrel, close to where the lancet would eject so you had more control. With the FastClix you have to use your thumb (I guess.) at the other end of the drum which gives you less control of the lancet. I have no clue why the company would make this change as it appears to be a poorer design. ADDENDUM [5/9/16]: Okay, the ergonomics of this device is a step back from the previous version, but here's the "rub." This device is less painful to use. I don't know why, but the lancet is not as irritating going in/out.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gibson, II

customer_reviews.title: Best lancet device out there
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has Type I and like most kids, hates to test. This is the least painful. Plus, the drum makes using a fresh lancet easy. The doctor gave us one after a discussion about testing. I bought this to have an extra in my purse for the days when my kiddo doesn't have her gear with her.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca D

customer_reviews.title: helpful
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Seems to speed up the process. Like others said, read the instructions. Otherwise you'll waste a drum. Once you reload it's ready to use. Don't cycle it at that point or you'll waste the first lancet.
customer_reviews.author: kreepykent

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery, packaged well.
customer_reviews.text: This item was a replacement and was exact duplicate of the one I needed. The needle cartridge is easy to refill and dispose of. Great product and seller delivered as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Most convenient
customer_reviews.text: I like not having to carry around little individual lancets in my purse. I also like the fact that when the drum is used up there are no needles sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Pain-free at last!
customer_reviews.text: Fastclix is the least painful lancing device ever! My fingertips stay pretty calloused from years of sticks. The Fastclix does the job even on the lowest setting . I keep one with my supplies at home and another one in a kit to take with me.
customer_reviews.author: yarnlover

customer_reviews.title: more of those for cheaper price but this is just so easy to do it’s worth it
customer_reviews.text: As a diabetic this is much easier than the single stick items that are out there. Sure you can get more of those for cheaper price but this is just so easy to do it’s worth it
customer_reviews.author: Cinderella, Mosley

customer_reviews.title: this is the best lance I have used
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse and diabetic, this is the best lance I have used. Simple to use with a tiny lance. They have dropped in price over the past four years. Found the drums recently in my neighborhood ....store's pharmacy for a reasonable price. I usually buy them from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, quiet, painless
customer_reviews.text: It's about as painless as you could hope for. Best of all, a couple of minutes after you use it, your finger tip is not sore.
customer_reviews.author: VoidMaster

customer_reviews.title: If you have to lance then FastClix is....
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy. New to diabetes so I have not tried any other lancing devices. Did a search on Amazon to see which device was recommended by customers and bought FastClix. Not going to say that lancing or injecting insulin is fun but much better than I thought it would be. Pain (more discomfort) is minimal. Hopefully I can loose some weight and give all of this up but until then I think I will stick with FastClix.
customer_reviews.author: RD Roberts

customer_reviews.title: they are often numb and blood flow can be poor. After running my hands under warm water
customer_reviews.text: This lancing device is virtually painless. It has many depth settings so it can be adjusted if you need a deeper or more shallow puncture. This is there only lancing device I will ever use. I suffer from Raynaud's which means I have pour circulation in my hands, they are often numb and blood flow can be poor. After running my hands under warm water, I can generally draw blood using a medium setting. Other devices did not work for me. I also like the fact that 6 lancets are loaded in one cartridge making it easy to change lancets. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: avid chef

customer_reviews.title: This, to me, is a big improvement over ...
customer_reviews.text: This, to me, is a big improvement over the Accu-Chek multi-clix device. this also runs in a 6 lancet drum (you need to get the drums marked for FastClix). There is no pre-cocking needed. Just push the top button and its over. With the multi-clix device I used to forget occasionally to pre-cock it, then have to scramble to get a sample before the meter timed out. Never a problem with this device.
customer_reviews.author: RSD48

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I like this lancing device better than the other kinds. When mine broke, I only had to replace it instead of buying a new diabetes monitoring kit. The price was right, too!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryle Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED....
customer_reviews.text: Not the same as the one that comes with the meter. It is shorter and often takes several attempts to get blood. It appears that the spring is not as strong as the original.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Perkins

customer_reviews.title: It works fine when it works but all the ones l've had ...
customer_reviews.text: It works fine when it works but all the ones l've had break way too soon. You take the cartridge out and the number doesn't reset to 6 and then it is useless. Poor design there and they know it they just dont care. Once a new design comes out i will stop buying this one... I've had 4 this year alone...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had stopped testing my glucose levels because of the pain associated with pricking my fingers. Because this device is so easily adjustable when it comes to the depth of the needle, it's virtually painless. I use a needle more than once which is a cost saving for me. Since I HAVE to prick my fingers, I'd rather do it as painlessly as possible. This device allows me to achieve that. It's the absolute best one I have used and I have tried many.
customer_reviews.author: Flo Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the best one I have come across so far. Makes finger pricking not so painful
customer_reviews.author: Paul Henry

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! JUST WHAT I NEEDED TO REPLACE AN OLD ...
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! JUST WHAT I NEEDED TO REPLACE AN OLD LANCING DEVICE THAT HAD QUIT WORKING. AND I RECEIVED IT QUICKLY SO I WASN'T WITHOUT FOR TOO LONG.
customer_reviews.author: musiclover

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best thing I have bought for checking blood sugar. Too easy
customer_reviews.author: Crusher

customer_reviews.title: Best I've had!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this so much I purchased two more for diabetic family members. We all agree it's the only lancet we ever want again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to load and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing Easy to use and you do not handle the needles Just load cartridge and go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Shadyknoll747

customer_reviews.title: Accu-Chek Fastclix lancing Device Kit
customer_reviews.text: This lancing device, in my opinion, is the best. Although the needle cartilage only has 6 needles, you are able to adjust the depth of the stick. I do and have recommended this device and have given them as presents.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I bought a second one because they are difficult to find.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa M. Jamerson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, minimal discomfort. Sometimes I don't even feel it. I test at the side of my fingers, not as sensitive as the ball of you finger.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for father.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for father, he likes it; doesn't use any other product.
customer_reviews.author: Najib

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lancet
customer_reviews.text: Looooove this lancet. Saves me time and is quick to prick finger. I admit the drums are expensive but I think it's neat to just push down on lancet and then slide to fresh needle inside the drum.
customer_reviews.author: Luvlytrinity

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Quick
customer_reviews.text: Quality device and works easily. No matter WHAT meter you use, this is the best item in the market yet for a quick lance.
customer_reviews.author: ArtistMom

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic finger saver!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best lancing device I have ever used. Far less pain & I love the drums - so convenient.
customer_reviews.author: KBC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I received the device and two inserts for it but haven't gotten the lancets yet.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the one that I was using and having ...
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the one that I was using and having 6 lances you only need to change it every other day.... NICE!Lives up to the name Fasclix...
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: A great system
customer_reviews.text: Takes a cartridge of 6 lancets. As a carer for an elderly diabetic relative this has been an invaluable addition as it saves a lot of inconvenience if collecting a blood sample is not successful the first time and causes less stress to my elderly relative.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely easier to use than having to insert the needles myself.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Downgrade from former counterpart
customer_reviews.text: It is not as amazing as its formal counterpart but works
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Although lighter in weight and not as sturdy, it is easier to use and the cartridges ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to switch from softwood,but this was cheaper. Although lighter in weight and not as sturdy, it is easier to use and the cartridges are several times cheaper. Now I prefer musing this devise. Less pressure and less pain!
customer_reviews.author: Srice

customer_reviews.title: So nice and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for diabetic needs. Fits nice in my Free Style case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Painless and easy
customer_reviews.text: I test 8 times a day and this device makes it easier than ever to switch out needles. I just slide the button over and a fresh sharp needle is there. I hope they never stop making this product.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Big difference between multiclix and fastclix. Not interchangeable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fastclix that I had previously, this one is much smaller than the multiclix barrels I have in abundance. So will probably give fastclix to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: lori gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Load a cartridge and you are good for 6 lances. I have tried others and they are so cumbersome. I recommend this to anyone who has to do blood testing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast.Pain Free
customer_reviews.text: Have used a variety of lancing devices. This is by far the best. You will pay a bit more,but the ease and comfort are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerJohn C

customer_reviews.title: Item is a must have
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device, you do not have to deal with the needles. Never do you touch them. great
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. I just started using it.
customer_reviews.author: RANDALL B.

customer_reviews.title: issues with plunger
customer_reviews.text: worked great little to no pain but sadly the plunger or popper broke after 20 uses and am now with out a lancer to do my checks hopefully this was just a defective item and not a design issue
customer_reviews.author: lester

customer_reviews.title: Click
customer_reviews.text: My favorite. Employs multi use cartridges that are easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: I have tried other lancing devices and am happy with how this product works
customer_reviews.text: The Fastclix works well. I have tried other lancing devices and am happy with how this product works.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Less pain.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to "love" something that pokes holes in you, but this system is so superior to the rest -- fast, easy, low-pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Coder

customer_reviews.title: Top grade product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, didn't use the one my manufacturer provided with the other kit, bought this one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrym

customer_reviews.title: So much better than other lancing pens!
customer_reviews.text: No more fumbling around with used lancets and those annoying tiny needle covers!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad we found this! My husband lost his device and he really likes the barrels instead of individual lances. A few days later, we were up and running again.
customer_reviews.author: MamaPete

customer_reviews.title: Sent as a gift, but I also own and ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent as a gift,but I also own and use mine and will never go back to the old single type lancets. This is virtually painless
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best thing to prick your finger. Super sharp and painless.
customer_reviews.author: Ancrene

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the individual lancets! Makes it so much quicker to take a reading
customer_reviews.author: Kriszena

customer_reviews.title: Like this Better
customer_reviews.text: I like the fast clix much better than the multi-clix that came with my Aviva monitor. I seem to have been able to find a better depth and it is less painful. Hopefully my doctor will change my prescription refill for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. Neat and much easier to use. It is less pain full as well.
customer_reviews.author: MFORD

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a backup. This lance is the best one I have found, and though I no longer use an Accu-Check meter I use this lance instead of the one that came with my new meter.
customer_reviews.author: klebs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Least painful lancer I've found! Highly recommend especially for those that need to check sugars regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are hands above better than the old style lancet systems. No pain in the fingers. At all...
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mc.

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: Love this device. So much easier and cleaner to work with. I hated working with the single lancelets. I would always stab myself trying to replace one for every use. This makes disposal very easy!
customer_reviews.author: Misslisa

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: I've use this lancet device for more than four years and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Syndyrue

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Fastclix. I'm changing my lancets more often. It's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast Clix
customer_reviews.text: I find this tester to be the best you don't see the needle's ì
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this product a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I have it set at the 2.3 depth setting and sometime I can't even tell that I've been stuck with the needle. Even when I do, the sensation is minor. I also like that I don't need to handle individual lancets. The only down side is I find it a bit bulky to use with my left hand .
customer_reviews.author: Randal Todd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a tremor and this is the only lancet device I can use
customer_reviews.author: cotton candy

customer_reviews.title: Really fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: My mother broke her old one and needed one really fast. It was delivered earlier than expected, and thank goodness because her back up one hurts her. If I ever need diabetic supplies on the quick I will definitely be coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Southerland

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy and More Painful Compared to MultiClix
customer_reviews.text: The older MultiClix was much better! With that one, you push down on the top to arm it, and then hold it like a pen and press a little button to fire the lancet. With this new FastClix, it's all done in one motion. You push down fairly hard to fire the lancet, holding the device in a fist (not a precision grip like a pen), which means you are putting more downward pressure on the target finger. I find this more painful and very awkward. The only "advantage" is the smaller drum size.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

product_meta.title: Fastclix Accu-Chek Fastclix Lancing Device Kit, Black
product_meta.description:
Fast Clix Lancet , New Addition in Accu-Chek Family, This item can only be used with Fast Clix lancets, ( NOTE: will not work with MULTICLIX or any other brand) Item come Brand new.

Reduce the pain and hassle of blood glucose testing. The Accu-Chek FastClix lancing device is the only 1-click lancing device with a drum of 6 preloaded lancets. Minimal side-to-side motion means less skin tearing and 11 depth settings ensure maximum comfort.
feature_bullets: No loading of Lancets Each time
Item can No be used with Any other Lancets
For Use with Fastclix lancets Only
